text: A pleasing act, for I [G-d] spoke and My will is being followed

Rabbi Eliezer said, the sons of Aaron died because they rendered a halachic decision in the presence of Moshe their teacher. Rabbi Yishmael said they entered the Temple while intoxicated, and the proof is that after their death the Torah warns against performing the service in the Temple while drunk.

A foretelling that the houses would have lesions. Since the Emorites his their wealth in the walls of their houses during the 40 years the Jews were in the desert, and because of the lesion they would have to break apart the wall and would find the treasure.
So he will not die, the way his sons did.
For if he comes (into the Holy of Holies) he will die
1 Who Will Slaughter Ox or Sheep: Of Sanctified [animals] the verse is speaking, as it says, "To bring a sacrifice."
2 In the Camp: Outside of the Courtyard.
"And Do Not Put a Stumbling Block Before a Blind Person." Before someone who is blind in a particular matter, do not give him advice that is not appropriate for him.
And you shall love your fellow as yourself: Rabbi Akiva said: "This is a fundamental principle in the Torah.

Apostasy. So these are 7 sins,  the first leads to the next and so on till the 7th. They are as follows; not to study, not to perform, abhorring others who do the commandments, despising the scholars, preventing others from their performance, denying the commandments, and apostasy
The seventy years of the Baylonian Exile were for the seventy years of shemitta that the Jews did not keep when they were in Israel. This angered Hashem.
title: Rashi on Leviticus
